arm_group.description: Cancer patients who have received proton therapy

brief_summary.textblock:
Proton therapy is a limited medical resource that is more expensive than conventional x-ray
      therapy.  To correctly measure the success of proton therapy in treating different
      conditions, it is important to check a patient's health status after their treatment is
      finished. Checking on the progress of patients over many years (called long-term follow-up)
      is needed because the long-term effects of proton therapy are not well known.

clinical_study.brief_title: Registry Study for Proton Therapy Clinical Outcomes and Long-Term Follow-up

detailed_description.textblock:
The objective of this research protocol is the development of a national Proton Therapy
      Center Registry for the purpose of:

        1. Performing retrospective research studies on diseases treated with proton therapy
           throughout the United States.

        2. Maintaining regular, lifetime contact with subjects in order to obtain current
           identification , contact information, and self/parent-reported health status in order
           to obtain a better understanding of overall treatment strategies and patient benefits
           of treatment.

        3. Permitting review of medical record information contained within the Registry to
           identify subjects who may be eligible for participation in future research studies
           conducted at the Proton Therapy Institution where the participant was treated.
           Obtaining the permission of Research Registry participants to be contacted to ascertain
           their interest in participating in future research studies being conducted  at their
           participating Proton  Therapy Institution for which it appears (i.e., based on medical
           information contained within the Research Registry) they may be eligible.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All subjects who are receiving or seeking medical care at the participating Proton
             Therapy Center will be invited to participate in the Research Registry.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects who do not agree to participate

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are seen/treated at proton therapy centers

clinical_study.official_title: Registry Study for Proton Therapy Clinical Outcomes and Long-Term Follow-up

Performing retrospective research studies on diseases treated with proton therapy throughout the United States.
Permitting review of medical record information contained within the Registry to identify subjects who may be eligible for participation in future research studies conducted at the Proton Therapy Institution where the participant was treated. Obtaining the permission of Research Registry participants to be contacted to ascertain their interest in participating in future research studies being conducted  at their participating Proton  Therapy Institution for which it appears (i.e., based on medical information contained within the Research Registry) they may be eligible.

collaborator.agency: IU Health Proton Therapy Center - Bloomington

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
